description: over- +‎ lash. Compare dialectal English lash (“extravagant”), lashing (“lavish”).

verbs.description: overlash (third-person singular simple present overlashes, present participle overlashing, simple past and past participle overlashed)

entries.meaning: To physically tie additional wires or cables to those that are already attached to a utility pole, accommodating any additional strands of fiber or coaxial cable on existing pole attachments
(obsolete) To drive on rashly; to go to excess.
(obsolete, by extension) To exaggerate; to boast.
